subtasks: Collecting transparent containers for seed planting
Filling containers with soil
Sprinkling seeds on the soil surface
Adding a thin layer of soil and pressing it down
Labeling the containers with planted seeds
Positioning the containers in a suitable outdoor location

tasks.task: Planting seeds directly in the ground of an unheated greenhouse
subtasks: Selecting appropriate seeds (e.g., spinach, milkweed, yarrow)
Clearing a designated area in the greenhouse bed
Distributing seed packets or seeds for planting
Planting seeds in the soil at the recommended depth
Marking the planted area for future reference

tasks.task: Considering factors for successful winter sowing
subtasks: Understanding the importance of mimicking natural conditions
Recognizing the benefits of cold and moist stratification
Monitoring temperature variations (e.g., extreme cold, day-night cycles)
Ensuring proper drainage and hole placement in containers
Protecting seedlings from wind, snow, and drying conditions
Checking the last frost date (e.g., May 15th)
Calculating the current date (e.g., February 5th)
Assessing whether conditions are suitable for indoor or outdoor sowing
Considering alternatives like mini or macro greenhouses for indoor seed starting
Gathering clear plastic containers like milk jugs or similar (SUBTASK 1).
Adding soil to the containers (SUBTASK 2).
Sprinkling seeds on the surface (SUBTASK 3) and covering lightly with more soil (SUBTASK 4).
Marking the containers to identify the contents (SUBTASK 5).
Placing the containers in a protected outdoor location (SUBTASK 6).

tasks.task: Planting Seeds Directly in the Ground
subtasks: Choosing seeds suitable for winter sowing (e.g., spinach, milkweed, yarrow) (SUBTASK 1).
Clearing designated areas in the greenhouse and mixing in soil (SUBTASK 2).
Distributing and planting seeds at the correct depth (SUBTASK 3).
Labeling the planted areas for future reference (SUBTASK 4).

tasks.task: Considering Factors for Successful Winter Sowing
subtasks: Understanding the importance of cold and moist stratification (SUBTASK 1).
Noting temperature variations to ensure seedling survival (SUBTASK 2).
Ensuring containers have proper drainage and protecting seedlings from elements (SUBTASK 3).
Evaluating if current conditions (e.g., February 5th) justify outdoor sowing over indoor greenhouses (SUBTASK 4).
